entries.title: Christiaan Huygens discovers the largest moon of Saturn, Titan
entries.caption: Man looking into a telescope at Saturn, saying 'That's a big-ass moon.'

entries.title: The UK introduces a driving test.
entries.caption: A car driving down the road with two people. One person says, 'You are really bad at this and we never should have allowed it.'

entries.title: Billy Dee Williams receives a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.
entries.caption: Yoda and Chewbacca standing on the sidewalk above Billy Dee Williams's star. Yoda says, 'Billy Dee Williams, who the hell is?' Chewbacca grunts in response.

entries.title: The Parliament asks King George II to seek redress from Spain, kicking off the War of Jenkins' Ear.
entries.caption: The king stands holding a red dress on a coat hanger and says, 'Okay, I got it, but I don't get it.'

entries.title: Queen Victoria gives royal assent to the British North American Act, which created Canada.
entries.caption: The queen stands and says, 'I think those Yanks need a nice hat. Make it so.'

entries.title: John Pemberton brews the first batch of Coca-Cola in Atlanta.
entries.caption: A man stands with wide eyes holding a bottle of Coca-Cola and says, 'Cocaine mixed with water is AMAZING.'

entries.title: The 23rd Amendment is ratified, giving residents of Washington, DC, a vote in Presidential elections.
entries.caption: A man standing in front of the US Capitol building with an 'I voted' sticker says, 'We're still not represented in Congress, though.'

entries.title: The Silence of the Lambs wins the Oscar for Best Picture.
entries.caption: A sheep and a man standing in a field. The sheep says 'baaah' but is cut off by the man saying, 'You shut up you little shit.'

entries.title: Daylight Savings Time goes into effect in the United States for the first time.
entries.caption: A man adjusts a clock and says, 'Time to spring forward!' A piranha creeper from Mario looks at the man and says, 'Say sike right now.'

entries.title: A paper describing how the elements came into being after the Big Bang is published by Alpher, Gamow, and Bethe.
entries.caption: Two men look at a chalkboard showing the formation of the universe. One says, 'So the whole universe is really just debris?' The other says, 'It WOULD explain a lot.'

entries.title: 2001: A Space Odyssey premiers
entries.caption: The computer HAL 9000 is speaking: 'Look Dave, I can see you're really upset about this. I honestly think you ought to sit down calmly, take a stress pill, and think things over. If you could see the next 19 years, you might not mind the lack of oxygen right now.

entries.title: Edward the Confessor is crowned King of England
entries.caption: A king stands with arms raised in victory and says, 'HA! I took the cookies, I left the seat up, I farted in the car, and now there's nothing you can do about it!'

entries.title: Ronald Reagan calls for a ban on chemical weapons
entries.caption: A man stands at a lectern and says, 'We should ban chemical weapons. Chemicals are very bad and we must completely stop using them to make weapons!' An aside reads, '...and peace reigned...'

entries.title: The Mayflower departs from Plymouth, Massachusetts, on a return voyage to England.
entries.caption: Two Pilgrims stand on shore walking towards a boat. One says, 'Let's get the hell out of here.' The other responds, 'Yeah, this place is bananas.'

entries.title: The first Tony Awards
entries.caption: A tiger stands to the side and exclaims, 'You're grrrrrrreat!'

entries.title: The World Trade Organization ends the long-running dispute between the United States and the European Union about bananas, ruling in favor of the US.
entries.caption: Two people stand before a judge. The American is holding a bunch of bananas and says, 'This shit is bananas! B A N A N A S!' The European responds, 'No it isn't, you cheerleader.' The judge sighs and says, 'Yeah, those are very clearly bananas.

entries.title: Grace Hopper and her team meet for the first time to begin creating what will eventually become COBOL.
entries.caption: A female admiral stands at a table of other people and says, 'Yes, everyone will make fun of it, but we must make it good because these doofuses will be using whatever we make for at least 60 years.

entries.title: Georgia declares independence from the Soviet Union.
entries.caption: The US state of Georgia says, 'I denounce the Soviet Union and declare my independence!' The US state of Alabama responds, 'Dude, what the hell?'

entries.title: Paul McCartney announces he is leaving the Beatles.
entries.caption: Four people are in a Volkswagen Beetle. One man stands outside waving and says, 'Sorry boys, it was just too cramped in there.'

entries.title: General Douglas MacArthur is relieved of command in Korea by President Harry Truman
entries.caption: A general stands speaking and says, 'Old soldiers never die, just fade aw– no! Wait! Not literally!' as his body fades away

entries.title: Billy Haley and the Comets record 'Rock Around the Clock'
entries.caption: A jukebox plays 'Rock Around the Clock' while Fonzie says 'eeeyyyyyy'

entries.title: First performance of Handel's Messiah
entries.caption: A choir sings on stage. A man in the audience stands with raised fist and says, 'You havent said Messiah a single time!

entries.title: US Civil War battle of Fort Pillow, Tennessee
entries.caption: Soldiers behind a pillow fort hold pillows above their head while soldiers on the other side charge with pillows.

entries.title: Jackie Robinson debuts for the Brooklyn Dodgers, the first African-American allowed to play in US major league baseball.
entries.caption: Jackie Robinson stands holding a baseball bat, wearing a Brooklyn Dodgers uniform with number 47.

entries.title: In Dodge City, Kansas, Bat Masterson has his final gunfight.
entries.caption: A bat-winged man with boxing gloves faces an oversided revolver for a fight.

entries.title: The Metro, Goldwyn, and Mayer film studios merge to create MGM.
entries.caption: A person is chased by a lion. They say, 'Why did we pick a lion?'

entries.title: BBC Radio news announces 'there is no news' and broadcasts music instead.
entries.caption: A person reclines in a chair and says, 'Best. Day. Ever.'

entries.title: Albert Hoffman deliberately doses himself with LSD for the first time.
entries.caption: A man seeing waves of colors says, 'The snozzberries taste like snozzberries!'

entries.title: Manfred von Richtofen shoots down two enemies, getting his 79th and 80th victories.
entries.caption: A red German Fokker Dr.1 triplane flies across the page.

entries.title: Baron von Richtofen, better known as the Red Baron, is shot down for the last time
entries.caption: Snoopy is dressed in old-timey pilot gear, sitting on top of his doghouse. He says 'got im'

entries.title: NCSA Mosaic web browser version 1.0 released, bringing the modern web to life
entries.caption: A person pointing at a calendar labeled April 22 says, 'And this is the day it all went to shit.'

entries.title: First game at Wrigley Field, then known as Weegham Park
entries.caption: Wrigley Field

entries.title: Mary, Queen of Scots, marries the Dauphin of France at Notre Dame de Paris
entries.caption: A queen and a dolphin stand in front of the Notre Dame cathedral in Paris. The queen thinks, 'He doesnt look anything like his profile pic...'

entries.title: The structure of DNA as a double-helix is reported in the journal Nature in three simultaneous papers by Watson and Crick (describing a physical model of DNA), and Wilkins and Franklin (describing the data that underpinned the physical model).
entries.caption: A DNA double helix

entries.title: Cubs outfielder Jack McCarthy becomes the first major league player to throw out three runners at home plate in a single game
entries.caption: A Chicago Cubs baseball player throws a ball

entries.title: Xerox PARC introduces the computer mouse
entries.caption: A mouse is sitting at a computer, typing commands

entries.title: Billy the Kid escapes from jail
entries.caption: A baby wearing a cowboy hat and holster is crawling away from a crib

entries.title: Joan of Arc arrives to lift the siege of Orleans in the Hundred Years War
entries.caption: A woman in armor stands outside a castle, looking out towards enemy soldiers and says, 'What if, instead of saving this old Orleans, we just built a new one?'

entries.title: Willem-Alexander is inaugurated King of the Netherlands after the abdication of Beatrix
entries.caption: A king is throwing an orange toilet screaming, 'KING OF THROWING TOILETS!'

entries.title: The Acts of Union joining the Kingdoms of England and Scotland into the Kingdom of Great Britain takes effect.
entries.caption: People gathered around a table, Scottish flags on one side, English on the other. Two people sit at the table signing papers. One Scottish person says, 'We're really going to regret this in 300 years or so...'

entries.title: Xi Ursae Majoris, the first binary star discovered, is spotted by William Herschel.
entries.caption: A man looks into a telescope at a pair of stars encircled with 001100010010011110100001101101110011 and says, '...0011?' Behind him, a paradox-correcting timesphere opens with a robotic leg sticking out.

entries.title: The Kentucky Derby is televised nationally for the first time.
entries.caption: A person is looking at a TV and says 'Why do people like this so much?' On the TV is a derby hat with the Kentucky flag waving in the background.

entries.title: The Bourbon Restoration begins in France with the exile of Napoleon and the new reign of Louis XVIII.
entries.caption: A bottle of bourbon wearing a crown says, 'Down with wine! Hail to the king, baby!'

entries.title: John T. Scopes is arrested for teaching evolution in violation of Tennessee law.
entries.caption: An angry monkey gestures wildly, wearing a golden cross and a sash saying 'William Jennings Bryan.' A person standing next to it says, 'I mean sure, not EVERYONE has evolved, but still...'

entries.title: The Works Progress Administration is created by President Roosevelt's executive order 7034.
entries.caption: A new bridge spanning a canyon and river

entries.title: The Second Council of Lyon begins in France to set rules for the election of the Pope
entries.caption: Two lions arue at a table

entries.title: John Pemberton sells Coca-Cola as a patent medicne for the first time
entries.caption: A man offering bottles of Coca-Cola on a table. A sign reads 'Cocaine Water 5¢.' The man says, 'This is some good shit first sip is free.'

entries.title: The first horsebus is debuted in Mumbai, India
entries.caption: A very long horse that is also a bus with some people in it

entries.title: Victoria Woodhull becomes the first woman to run for President of the United States nominated by the Equal Rights Party.
entries.caption: A woman stands in front of a lectern and says, 'What if we treated everyone with respect, gave equal pay, and stopped calling everyone 'guys'?

entries.title: Minnesota becomes the thirty-second state of the United States
entries.caption: The people stand in front of the Minnesota flag. The first says, 'Oh hey, we're a state now dontcha know.' The second responds, 'Oh you dont say!' The first person says, 'Oh yeah, it's true, you betcha!' The second person replies, 'Oh for fun!'

entries.title: The Donner Party departs Independence, Missouri, on a journey to California.
entries.caption: A prairie on a green screen with a wagon and ox in front. A banner beneath the wagon reads, 'You were eaten by your children.'

entries.title: Reggie Jackson becomes the first person in Major League Baseball to strike out 2,000 times.
entries.caption: Reggie Jackson stands at home plate as a pitch goes past. The umpire yells 'Strike three!' Reggie Jackson thinks, 'Yes! A record!'

entries.title: The First Crusade begins in earnest with the Siege of Nicaea
entries.caption: A man in a brown hat swings by on a whip. In movie font reads: 'Virginia Smith and the First Crusade'

entries.title: Mickey Mouse debuts in his first cartoon, Plane Crazy
entries.caption: A Disney 'mouse ears' logo with red eyes and the words 'OMNIA MEA'

entries.title: The nickel coin is established by an act of the US Congress
entries.caption: Two people are standing. One is holding four pennies and says, 'Man, carrying around more than 4 pennies really sucks.' The other looks thoughtfully and says, 'There must be a better way...'

entries.title: The New York Stock Exchange is founded
entries.caption: Four wealthy people at an expensive banquet raise gold goblets and declare, 'Fuck the poor!'

entries.title: The US Supreme Court unaminously decides that segregation of schools on the basis of race is unconstitutional
entries.caption: A judge bangs a gavel and declares loudly, 'SEPARATE IS INHERENTLY UNEQUAL.'
